title: 21 of the world's coolest outdoor cinemas
text:
CNN Leadership
21 of the world's coolest outdoor cinemas By CNN Staff Updated 0825 GMT (1525 HKT) September 29, 2015 21 photos: Six Senses Ninh Van Bay (Vietnam) – When night falls at Six Senses Ninh Van Bay , the deck at 'Drinks by the Beach' transforms into a starlit cinema showing a silver screen classic. Click on to see 20 other amazing outdoor cinemas around the world. Hide Caption 1 of 21 21 photos: Cinekamari (Santorini, Greece) – For less than than 10 euros visitors can watch classic English-language films with cocktails on the magical island of Santorini at Cinekamari . Upcoming screenings include "Infinitely Polar Bear" from October 3-6 and "Solace" from October 10-13. Hide Caption 2 of 21 21 photos: Shooting Star RV Resort (Escalante, Utah) – When the sun goes down, so do the tops on the classic 1960s convertibles parked at the Shooting Star RV Resort every Tuesday, Thursday and Saturday evening. With Red Rocks Canyon as the screen's backdrop, reality may be just as fabulous as what's on-screen. Hide Caption 3 of 21 21 photos: Six Senses Zighy Bay (Oman) – Get used to seeing Six Senses on this list. The luxury resort brand's outdoor cinemas are a signature offering for guests and Oman's Six Senses Zighy Bay is no exception. Plush loungers, gourmet popcorn and cool cocktails are also part of the experience. Hide Caption 4 of 21 21 photos: The Miami Beach Edition Hotel (Miami, Florida) – The Miami Beach Edition Hotel's sleek and modern seaside tropical hideout is outfitted with hammocks, low-lying beds and a huge outdoor movie screen, where guests can watch movies under the stars. Hide Caption 5 of 21 21 photos: Foreign Cinema (San Francisco, California) – Not really interested in chatting with your date? San Francisco Foreign Cinema pairs its ever-evolving high-end menu with a classic, foreign or acclaimed movie screening. Films change monthly. Next up? "The Wizard of Oz" will show through October. Hide Caption 6 of 21 21 photos: Six Senses Yao Noi (Yao Noi Island, Thailand) – Six Senses Yao Noi 's stunning " Archipelago Cinema " attracted a lot of attention a few years ago. Porsche Design Studio incorporated the largest LED TV in the world in a floating movie-theater set off the private island of Yao Noi in the Andaman Sea for a film festival. Though the floating auditorium no longer exists, the beautiful cinema pictured here is still open for guests of the resort. Hide Caption 7 of 21 21 photos: Red Rocks Amphitheater (Morrison, Colorado) – Ever thought you'd sit with 16,000 of your closest friends to watch a movie in an "acoustically perfect" amphitheater described by some as "carved by Mother Nature herself?" Every summer, the Red Rocks Amphitheater's Film on the Rocks season hosts a series of move screenings, each of which is preceded by a comedian and a performance by a local band. Hide Caption 8 of 21 21 photos: Hot Tub Cinema (New York, England and Ibiza) – This pop-up cinema operates in in several English cities as well as New York and Ibiza. Hot Tub Cinema's simple, but magical formula combines great films, amazing spaces and lots of hot tubs. Guests are encouraged to dress up, sing, dance and drink as they enjoy the film -- all while inside a hot tub. Hide Caption 9 of 21 21 photos: Soneva Kiri (Thailand) – Lit by the light of the moon Soneva Kiri's Cinema Paradiso is "a jungle-enshrouded auditorium of cascading cushions over the waters of the reservoir lagoon." The resort is located in southeast Thailand, on the tiny island of Koh Kut. Hide Caption 10 of 21 21 photos: Somerset House (London) – For 14 nights every summer, London's Somerset House offers the ultimate cinematic experience. When this London cultural icon isn't screening films it's got 55 dancing fountains in the courtyard and an ice rink in the winter. Hide Caption 11 of 21 21 photos: Gili Lankanfushi (Maldives) – Guests can watch the "stars" under the stars at Gili Lankanfushi's "jungle" cinema in the sand. For a little more privacy, staff will move the cinema to guests' overwater bungalows for a private viewing. Hide Caption 12 of 21 21 photos: The Cosmopolitan (Las Vegas) – For those who want a break from the casino floor, each Monday hip hotel The Cosmpolitan shows a "Dive-In" movie, backlit by the lights of the Vegas strip. Hide Caption 13 of 21 21 photos: The Graham & Co. (Phoenica, New York state) – This retro motel can be found in the cool, artsy town of Phoenicia, in New York's Catskills. The Graham & Co. 's vintage feel extends to the beautiful interiors and setting. Guests get free use of the motel's bikes as well as movie nights under the stars. Hide Caption 14 of 21 21 photos: The Pearl Hotel (San Diego, California) – For those looking for a sweet spot to swim and check out their favorite cinematic classics, San Diego's The Pearl gleams like a retro modern beacon. Thanks to San Diego's fantastic weather, movies are screened every Wednesday night at 8 p.m. through November. Hide Caption 15 of 21 21 photos: Alamo Drafthouse (Austin, Texas) – The Alamo Drafthouse's "Rolling Roadshow" series takes movies everywhere from backyards to racetracks to underground caverns. Earlier this year, it held a screening of "Jaws" at a man-made lake at the Texas Ski Ranch. For the latest Alamo Rolling Roadshow screenings, check out their website . Hide Caption 16 of 21 21 photos: L'Isola del Cinema (Rome) – One of the most famous open-air film festivals in Italy, L'Isola del Cinema takes place every year from June to September. The cinema is set beneath the romantic shadow of the bridge of Isola Tiberina on the only island in the Tiber river, which runs through Rome. Hide Caption 17 of 21 21 photos: Soneva Fushi (Maldives) – Guests of Soneva Fushi can park their lounger seaside and kick back with a hand-crafted cocktail paired with complimentary ice cream and popcorn. Hide Caption 18 of 21 21 photos: Skybar at the Mondrian (Los Angeles) – Every Monday The Skybar at the Mondrian hosts a Dive In Theater. Hit movies are shown while staff serve delicious gourmet bites and bubbly. Upcoming screenings include "Batman" on October 12 and Dick Tracy on October 19. Hide Caption 19 of 21 21 photos: Hollywood Forever Cemetary (Los Angeles) – Every summer since 2002 Cinespia has been screening Hollywood's greatest movies amid the gravestones of some of Tinsel Town's industry elite. In addition to showcasing the best of cinema, Cinespia cemetery screenings feature pre-show DJs, themed photo booths, a picnic at a gorgeous Hollywood landmark and even occasional visits by stars, directors and filmmakers. Hide Caption 20 of 21 21 photos: Sala Montjuic (Barcelona) – Though this 17th century fortress has a dark past, Sala Montjuic is one of the most successful examples of a castle that's been reclaimed for public use. Guests can bring picnic blankets and dinner as they take in both the screen and the sunset every Wednesday night. Hide Caption 21 of 21 (CNN) Save for a few quirky venues left to satiate the needs of nostalgic cinema goers, drive-in theaters are a relic of a past. What hasn't faded, however, is the appeal of catching a flick in the great outdoors. In fact, you could even say it's going through a revival. Location specialist The Venue Report put together a list of the world's coolest outdoor cinemas, which we've featured in the above gallery. Though many of these stunners are located at hotels and resorts -- there's even one in an RV park -- there are a few that are open to the general public. Chances are, you'll be so enthralled with your surroundings you won't even care if the movie's a stinker. More from Travel
